r:Abstract.r:Content: The 1970 British Cohort Study (BCS70) follows the lives of more than 17,000 people born in England, Scotland and Wales in a single week of 1970. The study covers various aspects of life, including health; physical, cognitive and social development; parenting; career paths; and economic circumstances. It also collects this information from a variety of sources, including clinical records, medical examinations, nutrition and activity diaries, parents, teachers and cohort members themselves. Findings from the study have been used to understand some of the most persistent challenges facing UK society, and have been a vital source of evidence on key policy areas such as social mobility, education, training and employment and economic insecurity. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study

r:Description.r:Content: The ESRC provides funding and support for research and training in the social sciences. It is the UK's largest organisation for funding research on economic and social issues. The ESRC is part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) which is a non-departmental public body (NDPB) funded by the UK government (Economic and Social Research Council, n.d.).
All those born, including still births, in one particular week in April 1970 until they die or permanently emigrate from Great Britain.

r:Abstract.r:Content: The first survey of the British Cohort Study took place in 1970. It's aims were to examine the social and biological characteristics of the mother in relation to neonatal morbidity, and to compare those results with those of the National Child Development Study (NCDS). Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-birth-sweep

r:Description.r:Content: Face-to-face paper and pencil interviewing.
Department of Child Health, University of Bristol.
The National Birthday Trust Fund was founded in 1928 as a UK charity that promoted the provision of maternity services.

OrganizationName.r:String: UK Department of Health and Social Security

r:Description.r:Content: The DHSS was a department of the UK government between 1968 and 1988. It was previously the Ministry of Pensions and National Insurance, and the Ministry of Health. In 1988 the DHSS was divided into Department of Health and the Department of Social Security, which then was merged into the Department for Work and Pensions in 2001. The Department of Health became the Department of Health in 2018 (Department of Health and Social Security, n.d.).

The MRC is responsible for co-coordinating and funding medical research in the UK. It is part of UK Research and Innovation (UKRI) which is a non-departmental public body (NDPB) funded by the UK government (Medical Research Council (United Kingdom), n.d. ).
All babies (alive or dead) after the 24th week of gestation in one particular week in 1970 in the United Kingdom.

r:PublisherName.r:String: Institute of Child Health, University of Bristol

r:Abstract.r:Content: The five-year follow up of the 1970 British Cohort Study took place in 1975 and was known as the Child Health and Education Study (CHES). It aimed to review and evaluate pre-school health, care and education services throughout Great Britain, as experienced by the cohort members. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-5-sweep

r:PublisherName.r:String: Institute of Child Health, University of Bristol

r:Abstract.r:Content: The ten-year follow up was the second full, national follow-up of the BCS70 cohort. It was designed to review and evaluate mid-childhood health, care, education, social and family environment throughout Britain. A number of considerations influenced the development of the survey instrumentation used. A major factor was the desire to examine ten year-old children's educational achievement and the ways in which it was influenced by other events. A wide range of earlier developmental, educational, social and health factors recorded previously on the same cohort could be influential and there was a particular focus on the effects of pre-school education and daycare, and learning disabilities. Health itself was another major focus of the follow-up, to provide a comparison with information gathered during the five-year follow-up. The comprehensive nature of the data gathered in this longitudinal study from birth onwards enables the examination of the effects on the ten year-old child's education, health and general progress, of perinatal problems, serious illnesses and critical episodes in the family or social environment. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-10-sweep

OrganizationName.r:String: UK Department of Education and Science

r:Description.r:Content: The Department of Education and Science was a department of the UK government between 1964 and 1992. It was replaced by the Department for Education in 1992 (Department for Education, n.d.).

The MSC was a non-departmental public body of the Department of Employment Group in the UK created in 1973. The MSC had a remit to co-ordinate employment and training services in the UK through a ten-member commission drawn from industry, trade unions, local authorities and education interests (Manpower Services Commission, n.d.).

The four Rowntree Trusts based in York, UK are funded from the legacies of the Quaker chocolate entrepreneurs and social reformers Joseph Rowntree and Benjamin Seebohm Rowntree (Joseph Rowntree Memorial Trust, n.d.).

OrganizationName.r:String: National Institute of Child Health and Development

r:Description.r:Content: The NICHD which is now named the Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development (NICHD) is one of the National Institutes of Health in the United States Department of Health and Human Services. It supports and conducts research aimed at improving the health of children, adults, families, and communities (Eunice Kennedy Shriver National Institute of Child Health and Human Development, n.d.).
All children born in one particular week in 1970 in Great Britain or who, having been born in that week elsewhere, emigrated to Great Britain.

r:Abstract.r:Content: The purpose of this study, the sixteen-year follow-up, was to review and evaluate adolescent (mid-teenage) health, care, education, social and family environment throughout Great Britain, as experienced by the BCS70 cohort. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-16-sweep

The Home Office is a department of the UK government which is responsible for immigration, security and law and order (Home Office, n.d.).

The CRC was formerly named as British Empire Cancer Campaign. In 2002, The Cancer Research Campaign merged with the Imperial Cancer Research Fund to form Cancer Research UK (The Cancer Research Campaign, n.d.).

The Beecham Group plc was a British pharmaceutical company founded in 1859. In 1989 it merged with SmithKline Beckman to become SmithKline Beecham plc, then merged with GlaxoWellcome to become GlaxoSmithKline in 2000 (The Beecham Group plc, n.d.).
The Kellogg Company, doing business as Kellogg's, is an American multinational food manufacturing company headquartered in, Michigan, United States (Kellogg Company, n.d.).
This information is currently not retrievable.
HTV was a British television service franchised by ITV. It was replaced by ITV Wales and West which was then replaced by ITV Cymru Wales and ITV West Country in 2014 ( ITV Wales and West, n.d.).

Channel Four Television Corporation is a publicly owned media company headquartered in London, UK. The company was founded in 1982 as Channel Four Television Company Limited, a wholly owned subsidiary of the Independent Broadcasting Authority, and became an independent statutory corporation in 1993 (Channel Four Television Corporation, n.d.).

Allied Lyons Plc formed in 1978 as a merger between Allied Breweries and the food and catering group J. Lyons and Co. The company merged with Pedro Domecq S.A in 1994 to become Allied Domecq PLC, which was an international company, headquartered in Bristol, UK, that operated spirits, wine, and quick service restaurant businesses (Allied Domecq, n.d.).

The William T. Grant Foundation is an American non-profit foundation that funds research in the social sciences, with a particular focus on reducing inequality in youth outcomes and improving the use of research evidence in public policy and practice settings ( William T. Grant Foundation, n.d. ).
The Sir James Knott Trust is a UK registered charity founded in 1990 (knott_trust, n.d.).
The Charles Hayward Foundation is a grant-making charitable trust making awards to charities that are registered in the UK (Charles Hayward Foundation, n.d.).
The Daily Star is a daily tabloid newspaper published from Monday to Saturday in the UK since 1978 (The Daily Star, n.d.).
The New Moorgate Trust Fund was a grant making trust founded in 1971. It merged with the Moorgate Trust Fund in 1992 to form the John Ellerman Foundation. (New Moorgate Trust Fund, n.d.).

LankellyChase Foundation is a registered UK charity established in 2004 from the merger of the Chase Charity and the Lankelly Foundation. The foundation established a number of funding programmes that aimed to identify charities struggling to access mainstream funding, usually because they were tackling hidden or neglected forms of disadvantage and harm (LankellyChase Foundation, n.d.).

The Laura Ashley Foundation is a UK registered charity, founded by Sir Bernard Ashley and his wife Laura Ashley following the success of the Laura Ashley brand. It was established in 1986 and was renamed the The Ashley Family Foundation in 2011 (Laura Ashley Foundation, n.d.).
All children born in one particular week in 1970 in Great Britain or who, having been born in that week elsewhere, emigrated to Great Britain.

r:PublisherName.r:String: Social Science Research Unit, City University

r:Abstract.r:Content: The BCS70 Age 26 Survey was the fourth sample follow-up of the 1970 BCS cohort. It focused principally on: youth training; full-time education; post-school vocational qualifications; unemployment; current or most recent employment; literacy and numeracy. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-26-sweep

MORI was founded in 1969 and was the largest independent research organisation in the UK. MORI merged with Ipsos UK to become Ipsos MORI in 2005 (Ipsos_MORI).

The Royal Free Hospital is a major teaching hospital in London, UK. The hospital is part of the Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust, which also runs services at Barnet Hospital, Chase Farm Hospital and a number of other sites. The trust is a founder member of the UCL Partners academic health science centre (Royal Free Hospital, n.d.).
All children born in one particular week in 1970 in Great Britain or who, having been born in that week elsewhere, emigrated to Great Britain before their 16th birthday.

r:PublisherName.r:String: Centre for Longitudinal Studies, Institute of Education

r:Abstract.r:Content: The 1970 British Cohort Study, 2004-2005 was conducted when respondents were aged 34. The main aim of this survey was to explore the factors central to the formation and maintenance of adult identity in each of the following domains: lifelong learning, relationships, parenting and housing, employment and income, health and health behaviour, citizenship and values. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-34-sweep

r:Label.r:Content: BCS70 Age 34 Follow up CAPI Questionnaire

The National Centre for Social Research is a registered charity trading as NatCen Social Research and is the largest independent social research institute in the UK. The research charity was founded in 1969 with the aim of carrying out rigorous social policy research to improve society (National Centre for Social Research, n.d.).

r:Abstract.r:Content: The 1970 British Cohort Study thirty-eight year follow-up took place in 2008-9. This sweep was conducted for the first time as a telephone interview (CATI). The main aim was to explore the factors central to the formation and maintenance of adult identity in each of the following domains: lifelong learning; relationships, parenting and housing; employment and income; health and health behaviour; and citizenship and values. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-38-sweep

r:Description.r:Content: Computer-assisted telephone interviewing.

All those born in one particular week in April 1970 in Great Britain or, who having been born that week elsewhere, emigrated to Great Britain before their 16th birthday and who had either taken part in one of the previous two sweeps (in 2004 and 2000) or who had personally confirmed their address or who had been traced.

r:PublisherName.r:String: Centre for Longitudinal Studies, Institute of Education

r:Abstract.r:Content: The 1970 British Cohort Study: Age 42 Survey took place in 20012-13. It consisted of a face-to-face interview and a self-completion questionnaire. Particular features included an assessment of adult vocabulary and consent to data linkage. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/cls-studies/1970-british-cohort-study/bcs70-age-42-sweep

TNS-BMRB which is now known as Kantar Public UK was established in 1933 and is now part of global Kantar Public network. It is a global market research and market information group (Kantar TNS, n.d.).
Self-administered survey using a traditional paper questionnaire.

All those born in one particular week in April 1970 in Great Britain or, who having been born that week elsewhere, emigrated to Great Britain before their 16th birthday and who had either taken part in one of the previous two sweeps (in 2008 and 2004) or who had confirmed their address before 2004 or who had been traced.

r:PublisherName.r:String: Centre for Longitudinal Studies, Institute of Education

r:Abstract.r:Content: The COVID 19 Survey collects information from participants in 5 national cohort studies about how the Coronavirus epidemic has affected their lives. The data from the survey will help researchers understand the health, social, and economic impacts of the COVID-19 outbreak. It will be especially important for understanding how people at different life stages are being affected, and how prior life experiences shape resilience or vulnerability to its effects. By following participants' lives into the future, the studies will be able to track the longer-term consequences of the pandemic too. Study website: www.cls.ucl.ac.uk/covid-19-survey/content-and-data/

r:Description.r:Content: Great Britain
Computer-assisted web interviewing (CAWI). Data are collected using a web questionnaire, produced with a program for creating web surveys

OrganizationName.r:String: Centre for Longitudinal Studies, UCL (Institute of Education)

r:Description.r:Content: The Centre for Longitudinal Studies (CLS) is an ESRC-funded resource centre based at the Institute of Education, University of London https://cls.ucl.ac.uk

The COVID-19 Survey Wave 1 involved participants from the 1970 British Cohort Study. Invitations to participate in Wave 1 were sent via email to all those for whom an email address was held, including emigrants, but not including those who have permanently withdrawn from the studies, died or been defined as 'permanently untraced'.
